page.title: 14ARCHITECTURE 1
page.content: The{church of all Saints}is of{12th {Century date.}The interior is unspoilt by Victorian 'renovators' who so altered the fabric of many of our medieval churches. Within the church are memorial brasses, and on a pillar in the south aisle{medieval graffiti, consisting of drawings of ships and geometric patterns. All saints is now a{'redundant church'}and is usually kept locked up. Although it is still concecrated. The local people want to see it opened for weddings, funerals, public meetings etc, and have applied to the Archbishop for this. In the churchyard beneath an ancient yew tree are buried members of the Culmer family, the headstones bearing dates in the 1750s. This family is also associated with Minster in Thanet, and Broadstairs, where they were ship- builders from the reign of Henry VIII.
